Column Comment.0: SEISMIC SET SUBTYPE: The seismic set type column is used to enforce arelationship between the SEIS SET supertype and its valid sub types. Values for thiscolumn must be the name of the table that is the valid sub type for this row ofdata.Valid entries include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_SEGMENT, SEIS_SURVEY,SEIS_PLAN, SEIS_WELL, SEIS_PROC_SET, SEIS_INTERP_SET or SEIS_3D.
Column Comment.1: SEISMIC SET: A seismic set is a super type of various types of seismic collections.
Column Comment.2: SEISMIC POINT ID: Unique identifier for each seismic point
Column Comment.3: FLOW IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for this occurence of flowing from a seismicpoint.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.7: FLOW DEPTH: The depth at which the flow originates in the shot hole.
Column Comment.9: FLOW DURATION: the time that this hole has flowed
Column Comment.10: FLOW DURATION UNIT OF MEASURE: whether the indicated FLOW DURATIONhas been days, weeks, months, years.
Column Comment.11: FLOW VOLUME: estimated or actual volume that is reported to be flowing from thehole.
Column Comment.13: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.14: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.15: REMEDIAL BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: the name of the person or company whoperformed the remedial action.
Column Comment.16: REMEDIAL DATE: the date when remedial action was taken on this flowing hole.
Column Comment.17: REMEDIAL ACTION INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether remedial action hasbeen taken on this hole.
Column Comment.18: REPORTED DATE: the date that this hole was reported to be flowing. Note that ahole can be repaired and later noted to be flowing again, requiring additional remedialaction.
Column Comment.19: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.21: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.23: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.26: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
